TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract PivotFilter

Docs.summary: A is applied to a object.

remarks.para: Developers have the option of naming filters for reference since the index is not reliable. The property specifies the to base a value filter on.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Active As Boolean
public: property bool Active { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns whether the specified is active. Read-only.

remarks.para: This property returns True when the of the filter is in the and the filter is evaluated when the is updated. It returns False when the of the filter is not in the and has no effect on the calculation.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: When used without an object qualifier, this property returns the Microsoft Office Excel . When used with an object qualifier, this property returns the creator of the specified object. Read-only.

remarks.para: You can use this property with an OLE Automation object to return the application of that object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As XlCreator

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit Integer that indicates the application in which this object was created. Read-only.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Excel, this property returns the string XCEL, which is equivalent to the hexadecimal number 5843454C. The Creator property is designed to be used in Microsoft Excel for the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Excel has the creator code XCEL.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DataCubeField As CubeField

Docs.summary: This property is applicable only to OLAP and provides the field ( in the Values area) being filtered by for a value filter. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DataField As PivotField

Docs.summary: This property is applicable only to non-OLAP and provides the field ( in the Values area) being filtered by for a value filter. Read/write.

Docs.summary: Deletes the filter and removes it from the filter collections of the and the .

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Description As String
public: property System::String ^ Description { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Provides an optional description for the object. Read-only.

remarks.para: The maximum length of the description String is 255 characters.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FilterType As XlPivotFilterType

Docs.summary: Specifies the type of filter to be applied. Read-only.

remarks.para: The following table shows the filter types that can be added to a . Arguments that must be supplied to the method for that filter type are marked “Required”, and those that cannot be supplied are marked “Unavailable”.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsMemberPropertyFilter As Boolean
public: property bool IsMemberPropertyFilter { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Specifies whether the label filter is based on the captions of a member property of the field or on the captions of the itself. Read-only.

remarks.para: The default value of this property is False.

Returns True if the label filter is based on captions of a member property of the ; or returnsFalse if the filter is based on the captions of the c. This property is valid only for Label filters and only for OLAP that have at least one member property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MemberPropertyField As PivotField

Docs.summary: This property specifies the member property on which the label filter is based. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property is valid only for Label filters and for OLAP that have at least one member property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Name As String
public: property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: This property provides the option of naming filters for reference. You cannot rely on the index value for accurate reference because this value can change.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Order { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Specifies the evaluation order of the filter among all Value filters applied to the entire . Read/write

remarks.para: This property is valid only for Value and Top type s. A run-time error is returned if an attempt is made to set or get this property for Label and Date filters. 1 represents the first filter evaluated, 2 represents the next filter evaluated, and so on, until the th value is reached. -1 represents an inactive filter.
If the property is not specified when a new filter is added, it will be set to (where is the current highest number in the filter collection).
The property can be specified in the method or it can be set later for a field by changing the property.

Increasing the evaluation order for a field will decrease the evaluation order of the field previously holding that evaluation order value—and all fields in between the two fields—by one. Setting the evaluation order to the same as before will have no effect. Decreasing the evaluation order for a field will increase the evaluation order of the field previously holding that evaluation order value—and all fields in between the two fields—by one.

The order of in the collection is the same as the order in which they are evaluated. So developers can change the order in which a is evaluated. When a (non-OLAP ) or a (OLAP ) is removed from the collection, this property is set to -1 for a Value or a Top filter applied to the field. Adding the field back again will set the property to for a Value or Top filter applied if a value is not explicitly specified.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool WholeDayFilter { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Sets or gets the filtering semantics for date filters. Boolean (bool in C#). Read/Write

remarks.para: The following describes the results for previous and current property settings:

item.description: False (Office 2010 behavior): Any time can be specified; dates are precise points in time (midnight of the specified date). Filtering date ranges start or end at midnight.
True (Office 2013 behavior): This behavior is enforced for Timeline controls. Only whole dates are specified; dates include all times-of-day until and not including the next day at midnight.

remarks.para: For a Timeline, always returns True; returns a run-time error when setting to this to False.
For a non-date filter, any access returns a run-time error.
